medical: The patient was placed in the left lateral decubitus position, and the above medications were administered. The oropharynx was sprayed with Cetacaine. The endoscope was passed under direct visualization into the esophagus. The entire esophageal mucosa was normal. The entire gastric mucosa was normal, including a retroflexed view of the fundus. The entire duodenal mucosa was normal to the second portion. The patient tolerated the procedure without complication.
layman: The patient was turned onto their left side and given the medications mentioned earlier. A spray of Cetacaine was applied to the back of the throat. A scope was carefully inserted into the esophagus. The lining of the entire esophagus looked normal. The lining of the whole stomach also looked normal, and the doctor looked at the upper part of the stomach by turning the scope back. The lining of the first two parts of the small intestine was normal. The patient had no problems during the procedure.
